title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: I totally get why everyone hates on this game but I love it. When I used to have an Xbox I did played through this game twice and now that I'm replaying on PC I have fallen in love with it once more. This is better than Valhalla in my opinion and I like the world more than Origins, though I prefer the feel/gameplay of Origins. Still love this game and am planning on completing a playthrough on PC.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Despite being an ambitious game, Assassin's Creed Odyssey often feels bloated. While the vast, open-world is beautiful, it can feel repetitive and is filled with unnecessary quests that drag down the experience. The RPG mechanics, a fresh idea, sometimes take away from the Assassin's Creed experience, making it feel more like an open-world checklist simulator. That said, the story is engaging and the historical setting is captivating, especially for fans of Ancient Greece. If you have the patience for the grind, there's still fun to be had

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Great game !! For me Odyssey is better than Origins.
Origins story is great but levelling up is boring.

Odyssey is the updated version. Very nice !! I recommend.

Edit:

After 73 hours of gameplay I can say the game is not optimised properly. About 8 times my game freeze and needed to hard reset the device, 1 time I felt from the map 😂 and once when I jumped from a mountain a got stuck somehow. 

Nothing major you will just die and start again from last saved file.

The frustrating part are the game freezes. I have an MSI laptop with 3070TI, I9 12th Gen and 32GB Ram all drivers with latest updates etc.

I'm curious by the time I will complete the game how many freezes I will still get .

Do I still recommend the game ? Yes.
Is poor optimised? Yes, but maybe not for all devices.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
As others have said, this isn't really an Assassin's Creed game, and if you're looking for that experience you won't find it here.

That being said, the game is still quite fun. Turn the level scaling down as far as possible and spec into the stealth tree, and you have a [i]decent[/i] if not entirely perfect stealth game.

The real draw of the game, however, is its setting. Classical Greece is a history nerd's playground, and to me it was worth full-price simply to explore classical Athens in all its original glory. Many of the historical figures that built the foundation of our real-world civilisation make an appearance, and seem to be depicted relatively well (for the most part). If you have [i]any[/i] interest in ancient Greece at all, including ancient Greek philosophy and theology, this is absolutely worth picking up for that reason alone.

If you don't have that interest, though, I'd give this one a pass. It's not a particularly good action game, nor a particularly good stealth game. The story is decent enough, but nothing particularly special, and the side objectives get quite monotonous after a while.

tl;dr: If you're interested in the story or the setting, pick it up on sale. If you're not, you'll find much better gameplay elsewhere.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
After 112 hours played, Ubisoft launcher gets updated and randomly requests a CD key. 

I close out of that and restart the game, a new pop up menu states: this will bind these games to this account.

I click okay.

New menu pops up and states: there was a problem authenticating blah blah blah....

I cant play the Effing game.

I cant refund the Effing game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Classic Ubisoft's game. A lot of question marks on the huge map, many events and action.
The main story line is ok, but the side quests are simple and boring after a while.
I love script of the main hero and its voice acting + there are joke moments (funny).
My whole oddysey (100%) + dlc took me 130 hours - not bad ;)
Nice game if you have plenty of free time.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Well thought out options and design, the art and music design lends itself to the tightly knit story held within.

8/10

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Fuck Ubisoft for making you log into their service to play a singleplayer game

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
A solid action-RPG set in ancient Greece. It looks wonderful, the main tale is good (Enjoyed the cult of cosmos missions) and the music is excellent, particularly the sea shanties . It also includes good skill trees.

I didn't like was the size of the map and the number of needless side quests. Odyssey feels too bloated for no apparent reason, especially because the objectives all feel the same after a few hours. To keep things fresh, I would have loved fewer but more relevant side quests with diverse mechanics, as well as cut scenes and high-quality storytelling.  (7.5/10)

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Extremely engaging action RPG much in the vein of The Witcher 3 but set in a beautiful recreation of Ancient Greece. It pretty masterfully weaves the stealth elements of the Assassin's Creed series into the action RPG, which is great--there's nothing more satisfying than clearing out an entire camp of enemies before any of them notice you.

Things I loved:
-The main quest-or "Odyssey" has three separate branches that interconnect with each other and the hundreds of side quests. One of these branches involves you hunting down members of an evil cult that's trying to control the Greek world. I found it extremely satisfying hunting down clues to discover the cultist's identities and then finally hunting down and assassinating these targets.
-Many engaging sidequests, and they have player guidance down to a science--you'll be on your way to do one thing, discover a sidequest along the way, and get completely sidetracked and uncover all the cool things to do in each region.
-I played Kassandra and she's such a lovely character who is voiced so well. The dialogue is written well too, I especially loved Athens and getting to have debates with Sokrates, Herodotus, Perikles, and other real historical figures. They're all done such great justice. 
-The skill tree has a lot of great abilities, broken down into ranged, melee, and stealth builds. You can respec at any time and try out quite a few different playstyles. 
-The game runs like a dream and is beautiful, even on older hardware. I have a Ryzen 5 1600 and a GeForce 1660 and I'm able to run the game at Very High settings 60fps.
-Combat is smooth and exciting. It's pretty well telegraphed when an enemy is going to use a move you need to dodge instead of parry.

Things I hated:
-Obnoxious, dirty cash shop. I'd recommend engaging with this as little as possible especially the "time savers" that give you extra gold, XP, crafting resources--you will farm all you need of this stuff just by playing the game.
-The loot grind. You will get dozens of pieces of gear per hour, most of which is useless. It comes in four varieties: Common, Rare, Epic, and Legendary. Common has 1 buff, Rare has 2 buffs, Epic has 3 buffs, and Legendary has 2 buffs but a special Set Bonus when you have the full set equipped. Common + Rare is strictly worse than Epic and Legendary, so whenever you get white or blue gear you might as well sell it or strip it for crafting materials which is tedious. The strongest min-max builds of the game require you rolling a good set of Epic Gear, but honestly you'll have a better time just finding a legendary set you like and rolling with that all game--in which case, the loot grind becomes even more meaningless.
-the timed "daily missions" etc are usually not very good but they drop tons of resources and are often convenient enough/on your way enough that you might as well do them. They absolutely feel like filler though.
-I'm finishing up the second DLC as I write this and after 143 hours the game is finally starting to feel like a slog. I much preferred the first DLC which is incorporated into the main game's map, rather than the second DLC which takes you to three separate world maps. The first and third maps of the second DLC look great though.
-Though I understand why it's done this way, the endless level scaling makes it hard to feel like you're progressing much. Also a little immersion breaking when you've fought literal gods and demons and then ten hours later you're fighting random greek soldiers who are just as hard.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
I loved the storyline and how many quests are available to play. The game really allows you to become involved in the whole family saga and relationships, making for immersive gameplay. 
However, there are SO many side quests. The main story line and main quests are enough to last up to 100 hours. I didn't think that all the small side quests were needed, I avoided all of them.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: I like this game the most in the franchise, might sound crazy but I love this game's world, characters, story and gameplay the most, I love the freedom in which you can choose consequences for some quests and the world in general

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: A game where you play as a Spartan warrior and You can't use a shield? That's ridiculous...  Specially when you put the shields in Origins.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Lots of people complain about the generic "Ubisoft Formula" for open world games, however this is one of those times where it actually feels good to me. The Greek world is fascinating, for those with even a passing interest in figures of the time, this game provides a fun representation. The combat system is alright, nothing to write home about but no complaints. The DLC has a few achievements locked behind it, but the content itself was quite fun and I feel like it was definitely worth the $12 or so I got it for on a sale. Don't really plan to attempt NG+, but I was overall satisfied with the storyline and characters.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: 10% cool story, 90% ubisoft slop. No clue why this is so highly rated, so I'm doing my part. Don't play this.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Assassin's Creed Odyssey wouldn’t be among my top five recommendations for someone new to the Assassin's Creed series. Despite its highs and lows, Odyssey feels more like a departure from the core Assassin's Creed experience. For starters, there’s no hidden blade, and the game emphasises action over stealth (even so the combat mechanics can get broken when dealing with a lot of enemies) to the extent of being able to run and do parkour in seemingly any direction and in impossible locations. If the game didn't carry the Assassin's Creed name, I might appreciate it more.

As someone interested in Greek history, especially Spartans, I enjoyed encountering mythical creatures like Medusa and the Cyclops, and playing as a descendant of Leonidas was cool. However, the game’s grindy nature and heavy focus on action does make it feel less like an Assassin's Creed game.

On the positive side, AC Odyssey has impressive animations, stunning graphics, and a vast, engaging game world that feels like a giant playground. However, the writing and story fall flat, with only a few moments designed to keep players engaged.

If you're looking for an action-packed game with a Greek historical backdrop, I’d recommend trying out God of War 1, 2, and 3 first, or even Hades, which has received great reviews. Odyssey would come after those, and that's only because I haven’t explored many games delving into ancient Greek mythology. Overall, I’d give the game a 6.5/10!

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
I just started this massive game. I bought it on sale. Graphics are unbelievable, there's a lot of controls but configuring it all made it a lot easier. Really what drew me in was the stealth system, I love sneaking up on baddies and taking them out. The original concept of AC was always stealth and staying in the shadows, so I'm def playing in that style and trying to avoid a lot of combat. 
The leveling system seems easy to learn, less numbers than Elden Ring. It's streamlined. Also the game itself is much easier, sometimes I need a break from tough games. Not saying this is a breeze, but compared to classic Tomb Raider and Elden Ring? This is on the easier side. 
The open world seems vast, I also love the time period. As I write this, I'm re-watching the TV show Spartacus and this kinda feels like a bigger version of that. Looking forward to seeing the rest of this game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
There are many things to say about Odyssey and I don't know where to begin with. It is a masterpiece. It has been a love and hate relationship with this game. I highly recommend the game, however, you should look into gameplay videos first etc. 

My overall rating is 7/10. If we were living in a perfect world, it was a solid 9/10. I deducted 2 score points because of the irritating and somewhat frustrating combat. Note, I didn't check on Youtube videos or read any reviews beforehand because I wanted to fully surprise myself and see how it is. 

Good
+ Incredible graphics for the most part but overall for that time of release, it was a superb engine
+ Amazing depiction of Ancient Greece. You can fully immerse yourself in the vast landscape
+ Plenty of missions and side quest (which can have some minor negatives too) 
+ Likeable protagonists, interesting characters and some funny bunch
+ Great weapons and upgrade system
+ The story is amazing 
+ Honorable ancient people like Sokrates, it was such a highlight for me how he was depicted and featured in the game
+ Great options for decision making in-game
+ Incredible naval experience, oh my goodness

Neutral
/The map is HUGE. Overall I don't find it negative
/HOWEVER, one can easily get lost and side tracked with other things and mission that has nothing to do with your actual main quest.
/I didn't enjoy the cave missions that required me to go Indiana Jones. 


Bad (Note: This is my PERSONAL view and experience) 
- Frustrating combat and GTA-like bounty system. Let me start of saying, when you reach level 99, most of the opponents are level 97-99 too! It was incredibly irritating and often frustrating to fight.
- The game gives an impression I have "the full freedom" on how to approach the game and play it. Hmm, the moment when you don't go stealth, you might get a whole city population against you and on top of that, 5 mercenaries. You can buy the bounty off etc but it is still incredibly frustrating. They will also appear on screen when you are about to enter a main quest mission. I don't know why was this flagged during their QA game testing. 
- Unfortunately, not all mythical monsters are part of the main story and many of them are linked to side quests and you have no idea which ones without googling. 
- A handful of cultists location give a wrong impression. For instance the description says they are in location A. But he's not even there! They are scattered across the maps and you need to do something in order to trigger a certain event, which, where and what??? There were some time I just had to use Google and Reddit and I have to admit, I hate doing that because it somewhat degrades the game experience. But I was so stuck and had no clue what to do next. 


Overall, a masterpiece. One of the best AC games.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: I played this a couple years ago. Wanted to play it again but the third party launch Ubisoft Connect isn't working at all. No sign in screen. Nothing. Run as administrator. Nothing. I have also had issues with Origins which I never even got to play on PC because it doesn't work. Everything about Ubisoft is so janky.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: My second AC game that I played through the whole thing, first being Syndicate. Odyssey with its Ancient Greek setting was what kept me playing and exploring more, the story line is very good and the quests are interesting. To me the combat system is way better and smoother than Valhalla. I've played the new AC games up to Mirage and I can safely say nothing beats Odyssey

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
It's a beautiful game. I loved the first few weeks playing around. Loved the ongoing fight between Athene and Sparta and randomly side with them, discover places, sail around the galley, jumping and climbing. Looking the cities, villages. Discover islands. Loved that there is not that silly future part shoehorned in it, you pretty much play as that Greek hero and mercenary and slowly discover stuff around.
The problem is its not really changing over time. There is no exciting new weapon or armour to play with. They all the same with slightly different stats. The content feels repeating. You may prefer to play sneaky, but there will be forced battles where you just cant play that style. There will be a point when you keep seeing the same type of place over and over again, you keep fighting the same battles and relive the same situations. 
Its not bad but I just can get myself to finish it. After 60hr I felt I just playing circles and saw everything. Maybe I am wrong but I just cant see this game can change anyhow. It's not like ER where you find a new weapon what completely change the way you fight. You cant say you play as an Archer or a sneaky assassin as you keep getting into pit fights where you simply not allow to cheese up the enemy or outsmart it, but bind to play in one way and one way only.
The game is huge and can give you content for ages but I feel its just scaled up  without any meaningful gameplay loop change. Playing the Athene - Sparta war is fun for a while.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Overall gameplay is really nice, its not hard but its not too easy. Sadly the amount of grind in this game sucks huge cock but if I ever complete the story in this game ill rewrite the review

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Probably the best Assassin's Creed game, I can only think of a single real negative thing about it and it shares this with Origins, which is that Ship combat peaked in Black Flag. The ship combat in both Origins and Odyssey is fine but way worse than Black Flag's. With Black Flag style ship combat this might be the perfect Assassins Creed game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
As an AC game it was not so good but as an RPG game with open world was great. The sound and visuals were amazing. 
The story was pretty good. The combat was pretty good after about 20 hours of playtime i got used to the style. In some places the game was a bit bloated but overall experience was nice. I would say worst and terribly made were conquest battles. It could be much better and more immersive if you would have to attack or defend forts and complete objectives as war campaign. But in my opinion they wasted the opportunity for multiplayer which had SO MUCH potential as naval battles and with so many different abilities the combat would be amazing!!!

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: 10/10, i personally don't see it as an assassins creed games because i don't identify it as one instead i see it as an Rpg open world game and thats why its 10/10

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Positive for:
Mechanics, environment, theme, navigation, exploration and combat.

Negative for:
Lack of interiors & repetitive gameplay.

An overall good-looking game that got me sinking 120 hours into it for its awesome exploration.
Sight-seeing is great, for the towns, ports and cities are beautiful.
An 8/10 for me mostly because of missing character creation.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: be romantical with every character because i'm just that freaky 10/10 would be freaky again, oh right this a review, it's a gud game with kewl lore but i already knew the lore cuz i done played on my ps4 and i basically finished the game there cuz i'm just THAT GOATED then i com back because i wanted to get freaky again~ but yes it's not like the "normal" assassin's creed games... it tries to be cool and be an rpg.. and i love rpgs especailly explosive ones, ehehehheheheheheheh bazookas... wait no i meant role-playing games, i roleplay as the freakster. yes that's me, anyways buy the game and talk to me about how romantical you were, come over here and kiss me on my hot mouth, i'm feeling romantical.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Here comes the legend Greece and the legend of Zeus, Hermes and more, fight the legend bests like Minotaur, Sphinx and etc. The myth comes in front of you. This was an old game released six years ago, but it still worth playing and good enough even for nowadays.
Recommend, definitely. For Ubisoft, please make your latest Assassins' creed series come to steam.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
It was one of the best RPG games I played. Compared to previous AC games, stealth isn't the main focus, but I didn't mind. It's a steal if you buy this one on sale. 

**Works very well on Steam Deck OLED.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Loved: Story is 100% historically plausible while playing as Alexios as misthios. Alexios should be the "canonical" misthios.

Liked: Graphics. Worldbuilding. Overall plot and storyline. Humor.

Hated: Storyline is 100% historically incompatible with Kassandra as misthios. Kassandra should not be the "canonical" misthios.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Holy shit! That's all I can really say lol, nah but there's waaayy more comin haha. 
Short story, it's a bomb game and if you're like me and new to the Assassin's Creed franchise, even in 2024 this is absolutely worth the regular price of the game, hands fucking down all the way.

TL;DR
I've NEVER been interested in the lore behind video games, even after playing WoW for 15+ years and Destiny 1/2 until recently. Almost without fail, every cutscene, every quest RP bs, every lore-related location/mission/items whatever, nothing seemed to capture my attention with the lore. Not sure why because I wasn't really opposed to it, but nothing I experienced in those games, despite being pretty much all about the lore, nothing really brought me into the game in a meaningful way. Now all of that is to say this game changed that for me, seriously.

I think I remember playing a few hours in the og AC on PS2 I think, but that was a lifetime ago and I consider myself pretty new to the franchise. I was a bit caught off guard when I first fired up Odyssey and saw the frequent cutscenes and deep RPG elements of the game that I apparently wasn't anticipating. Yeah yeah, "but it's a RPG lol" yeah I know, but still for a non-lore player I guess I didn't really know what that would look like in-game. That thought lingered for about, well about as long as the first quest, because I was hooked man. It was a weird experience but I was there for it! Now granted my play style is a bit herbally-infused so there is that, but still the level of detail and immersion combined with the fucking 5 star AAA quality graphics, the story writers really shine in this game for real! I haven't skipped a cutscene yet. Yeah there's some repetition with types of activities at certain points, but at about 13 hours in at this point I think, idk it's just captivating as hell man, you gotta try it if you haven't yet! Don't even wait for the sale though for real, it's worth it.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: the abilitys are cool. doesnt feel very assasin like but still very fun and over all easy to enjoy.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Very nice game, and though it is too big, i still remember the shock when the whole map is opened for the first time

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
despite the shit this game sometimes gets, this is by far my favorite of the 3 "new" AC games! If you're interested in greek history and love an open world RPG you should check this game out! 

Not perfect but still amazing in my opinion.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Amazing experience for explorers. Gameplay might be a bit bumpy due to the usual overlooked bugs of the Assassin's Creed franchise and the Ubisoft Studios.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Intresting story line and you will be able to make your character either too powerful either too average

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: A truly outstanding game, and I'm no fan of Ubisoft. This game captures the Greek mythos perfectly and its easy to get lost in the world. You will forget it's an Assassins Creed game at some points, but it is through and through. The game deals more with the lore side of AC and the mythos of their origins and the Isu, and i wont spoil it further than that. Its prob my favorite single player game and i am on my third play though now. Absolutely worth getting with all of its DLC.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: it may not be like other ac games but as a rpg centered around greek myths and legends and the war with spartans its all you could ask for

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: This game from the New AC ERA is very good. I tried valhalla and got bored within seconds must be me. Im a simpleton gamer and i currently cant think of cons. Pros would be ships are fast, a variety of different scaled enemies, the skills and the teleportation makes the game fun. You have fun killing people till someone tries to kill you while youre still trynna kill people all i can say.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
If you want an RPG set in ancient Greece, this is your game. As a fan of this period of time, this game was awesome. Good graphics, long game hours, not just with a long campaign but also a ton of extra activities.

As far as Assassin's Creed games go, this is a different beast compared to the older games. It is aiming to be like The Wither 3, based in an Ancient Greece set in the AC world. You will know if that is your thing or not.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Very nice RPG. The world is HUGE and the story is long (many side quests needed to progress). Ancient Greece in this game is beautiful and is a joy to play through. Very different from previous games in this series, but if that doesn't matter, give this a try. It's an amazing game on it's own.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Great game. 

This has been surprisingly fun:
The game shines with its combat and its vast open world. The quests are not on the level of games like "The Witcher 3" but still entertaining with interesting decisions to be taken.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: It's my favorite Assassin's Creed game, Black Flag, but better. Everything is a tad bit more refined from the last games but it doesn't do anything too groundbreaking. If you were getting bored from the last AC games this one won't really add much of anything new.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
first off this is no assassin creed, it has element of creed like the animus, etc.

secondly thats a good thing imho. this has some of the best elements of shadow of mordor and witcher 3. infinite play-ability. 
just think witcher 3 with greek lore instead of polish lore. the way you take and acquire lieutenants as your own men reminds me of taking those pesky orcs on mordor and making them fight or you, i havnt checked the lvl cap yet but i dont think there is one the way it has system of paragon lvls @ lvl 50 and after youve decided where your skill tree stops.

the graphics for a 7 year old game are highly polished, running it on a 40 series nvda gpu and an amd ryzen 9 7050 xtx, this game sings like my triremes row-men.

i waited too long to pull the trigger on this game because most AC games i find trite and childish in the narrative, this is however highly interesting with "elements of history, and how they twist that history to their narrative is much better than the games in the past.

im in act 3 and have 100+ hours put on this and only really sailed to 8 out of 50? islands on the map, it was almost overwhelming when the full map popped up (almost). super stoke that the map is also true to the aegean sea, 

hahaha they said lesbos.

nuff said, buy this game, oh and you can play with other peeps too, havnt tried that element yet.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: This was the last well crafted Assassins Creed game from Ubisoft.. The game is truly incredible. Whether you wanna sail the 7 seas, or take out the bounty hunter that's been tracking you for days. Very limitless game play with a GOOD story. Mainly played on my Xbox but so good I needed the Steam version as well

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
After a very long time of having this sit in my library, I finally started playing it and I have to say, by now it is a really nice and entertaining game.

I am not the greatest AC fan, so I enjoy this game as an RPG, more than an AC game. And I guess, that's a good thing here. Apparently it fails at being AC enough for some, but it does really tick the boxes for someone who likes a fun RPG. It has a very good looking environment, lots of things to discover, a fun and very extensive story and a ton of side quests (which i didn't get to exhaust at all after > 50h), and much more.

There is definitely more than 100h of fun to be had in this game, if you take it for what it is.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Completed this on ps4 and just had to play it again on the deck.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Played it three times and for me it is the best Assassin's Creed of all of them! Sadly it was most likely the last good one. I hope I'm wrong.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: this game is fascinating i love how they serve the historic buildings and story in this game, but somhow you need to know a little bit of athens history if you want to know the story well

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: A bit bloated, but they did a good job with the environmental assets that you can't just stop playing. Combat is fun too.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Awesome game! I wasn't a huge fan of the newer ones (anything past Black Flag). I played the old ones, AC2-4 and Syndicate and really enjoyed those ones, but I really didn't enjoy Origins or Mirage. I thought I would try Odyssey since it was on sale and I really enjoy it. Even though it is an RPG and not really like the old ones at all, I'm actually really enjoying the combat and gameplay. A plus is you can turn off enemy health bars.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Would definitely recommend buying this game on a discount, perhaps even on it's full price but I'm not too sure about that.

Great graphics on this one, I really commence the amount of details they've managed to invest in this game considering the scale of the map (which is enormous), also props to Ubisoft for the historical research that they did to make this game, I think they went farther on this one than with AC:O (perhaps because it's a more documented place and time period). The RPG system in this game is much more polished than in AC:O, reminding me more of The Witcher games than traditional AC games (it's the farthest experience from an AC game yet), that's along with it's more interesting and engaging story-line than in AC:O (which is dictated by your choices, yet, it lacks the memory corridors of AC:O), atleast in my opinion. Also didn't face any bugs on this game. Would also mention the side characters being better than in AC:O, however, the main character isn't as well performed as Bayek.

Like any RPG game it does get repetitive and grindy at times. I felt the difficulty on this game was also done better than AC:O (probably due to level scaling which often makes you calculate your steps, atleast on hard/nightmare mode), however the bounty hunters on this game are a bit too annoying than in AC:O since they always teleport an area nearby to you unlike in AC:O where they roam the map and the nearest one to you will head to your direction from where it was if you've done too much mess. Perhaps my only noticeable gripe is that the canon story line seems to fit more the female protagonist than the male protagonist story-line wise but that's what you get for trying to please everyone I guess and it only shows sometimes and doesn't negatively affect the game as a whole.

It's the only game in the series where you can start playing it since it's so detached from the series as a whole, you might even say it's a different game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Good game, doesnt have much to do with the old AC games, but nice openworld game with beautiful locations and all in all gorgeous look.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: A worthwhile time sink if you like playing around min/maxing your gear and character build type RPG.  Good storyline, although some of the no plot randomly generated generic mission are a bit samey. Keep a few saves, sometimes it is not obvious how your decisions will affect developments until much later in the game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
I'm an Assassin's creed fan since the very first game. And in my opinion AC Odyssey is great: unbelievably beautiful and entertaining, very catching atmosphere that makes you want to explore the world (I even went to Greece thanks to the game and now it's one of my favourite countries!). Nice DLCs, though I was quite disappointed in some plot twists.
But of course I can't not mention the neverending fort missions - huge dislike for that! Cut them off from the game and plot-wise nothing would change, but the players would be so much less annoyed and more satisfied and happy!

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
About everything and nothing - this is about Assassin's Creed Odyssey!

Yes, the game is good and it's a big interesting story..
But the game was made by ubi*, so there's a lot of grinding and unnecessary activities, a lot of unnecessary garbage!
If you want to close it 100%, you'll have to bite your lip and endure..

And I've already finished the story, I'm going to close the DLC.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Very good game with good mechanics and story. Best AC I've played so far

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Honestly the best assassin's creed game in the entire franchise. I have played almost the entire roster of assassin's creed game and this one is hands down the best in the series. wish they would've kept with the gameplay mechanics in this game for the following games in the series.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Honestly, once the general gameplay loop loses its shine the game is just really boring. A lot of quests end really suddenly and feel unsatisfying, and the ending feels like the entire story just fizzles out. Kassandra is pretty great though.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Maybe a 6/10 since overall would say that the game is alright if you like the AC game series in general. Took around 130 hours to get all achievements, there are many places to explore, but I must admit that many sections of the game feels very repetitive such as the military camps where even the location of the chests were the same. I liked the aspect of customizing your gear to look any way you wish, but the upgrading system is tiresome since you basically upgrade it every level till it reaches the current one. By the time I explored everything and did all the quests, got around level 88, you also have the option of a New Game plus but considering the repetitiveness and grind, you don't feel much encouraged to replay it especially since you are so high level by the time you access New Game plus and the max level 99, beyond that you will stop getting any xp and everything becomes like a chore.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: fun game to play especially if you are into ancient greece and the mythology

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
1. Opened the game, it forced me to create an online account even though I wanted to play offline (not specified in the store page, which just mentions an external launcher).

2. Game didn't create savefiles. I search help online.
Restarted their external launcher, which forced me to log in again. I had lost the account details for their third party compulsory online launcher because I wanted to play offline.

3. Their support team ignores me and denies account recovery even though I provide proof of purchase (I contacted them less than 24h after buying the game, surreal).
While I am stuck on the launcher log in screen trying to solve this, the time spent counts towards played hours. Win-win! That makes requesting a refund hell on Earth.

[b]Conclusion[/b]: I'm not saying 'don't buy the game'.
I'm saying 'don't buy anything from Ubisoft or any other company that requires an Internet connection when you want to play offline, ever again'.
Let me add that without Ubisoft this would be a 10/10 game. Put their "compulsory door" in the front and it becomes a 0/10. And apparently there is a specialized team making sure there are 'multiple gender identities, racial origins' and many other nice things but their Support team simply refuses to work.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
It's not an Assasin's Creed game, but I could handle this if game wasn't so boring. Basically, Odyssey is an MMORPG where devs forgot to add MMO.  Too many grind, a lot of microtransactions. Want something in game? Either pay or spend another 10 hours and even after you will most likely level up and your things won't be so cool anymore. 99 levels? Are you kidding me? And for what purpose? Auto-leveling system won't let you feel your proggression unless you find some cheese strategy. I like Origins location-based system more, but that's just for me. 
Okay, in fact you don't need to have 99 level unless you really want to and it's not the biggest problem of the game. I feel like the biggest problem is world itself for sure. Yes. indeed it is beautiful and devs can have my credit for this, but tell me why it's so...dead and empty? Yes, we have tons of collectables and lots of question marks on the map - much more than Origins have - but even so the desert of Egypt appears to be more lively and enjoyable. I just don't want to explore the world where all I can find is another outpost which is, don't get me wrong, bad for Origins too. Yes some may like it, but for me it is a lazy way to fill the map. 
I can't say anything for the main storyline. It's not bad, it's just fine unless you realize that you have no assassin in assasin's creed game. And even DLC 'Legacy of The First Blade' which could explain a lot of things about hidden blade, how it was created and why such a design, it tells you everything but not about hidden blade. I haven't finished DLC's yet (and I won't, at least right now) but I have seen how it ends and I have just one question: WHY the hidden blade was given to Aya by Cleopatra IF it's Aya's family legacy? 

Does the game have nothing to offer? Well, it is not true. I like mercenary system and cultist system (though it needs to be improved). Combat system is better than it was in origins though why I have paranormal naruto-ninja techniques...okay, it's ancient technology and animus. Okay, let it be. Odyssey also have some fine quests lines, I even chuckled at some of them, but guess that's all.

Some dude once commented my profile and said that 'Origins and Odyssey will be my best experience' and that I should try them necessarily and I was like 'Yeah, sure I'll try them out'. And now I'm dissapointed. I really liked origins, it was not the best game in any way but I had my fun, but here...nothing. And unfortunately Odyssey is the first game in the series which I'm NOT reccomend to buy unless you are fan or it's on a huge discount. Yes, I have heard that Valhalla explains a lot and fixes a lot, but I rate the game here and now and at this condition...No.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Skriv et reviewAssassin's Creed® Odyssey Review: A Stunning Epic of Choice, Family, and War

Assassin's Creed® Odyssey is one of the most ambitious entries in the Assassin’s Creed franchise, offering a vast open world set in ancient Greece and a deep, branching storyline driven by player choices. With breathtaking visuals and a narrative focused on family, war, and destiny, the game delivers a remarkable experience for players looking for both stunning graphics and a long, emotional journey.

Hours of Gameplay with Meaningful Choices
One of the standout features of Odyssey is the sheer amount of gameplay it offers. With over 60-100 hours of content, depending on how much side content you pursue, Odyssey is packed with quests, exploration, and combat. The game is designed to keep you engaged for the long haul, with a story that unfolds gradually as you make key choices that impact not only the outcome of your journey but the world around you.

The branching storyline allows players to influence how the game develops. Choices in dialogue and actions can lead to multiple endings and affect relationships with various characters, including friends, enemies, and even family members. The ability to shape the story adds a sense of personal investment, giving the player a sense of ownership over their version of the narrative.

A Story of Family, War, and Loss
At the heart of Assassin’s Creed Odyssey is a tale about family, legacy, and the destructive power of war. You play as either Kassandra or Alexios, mercenaries searching for answers about their family's past while navigating the chaos of the Peloponnesian War between Athens and Sparta. The story masterfully intertwines themes of loyalty, betrayal, and the difficult choices that come with war.

The game doesn’t shy away from showing how war can tear apart families and destroy entire civilizations. Through your interactions and decisions, you witness firsthand how your choices ripple through the lives of others, whether through forging alliances, protecting your loved ones, or deciding the fate of nations. This emotional depth makes the narrative of Odyssey one of the richest in the series.

Second-Generation Graphics That Dazzle
Graphically, Assassin's Creed Odyssey is a true masterpiece. The game’s attention to detail, from the vibrant sunsets over the Aegean Sea to the intricate architecture of ancient temples, creates an almost photorealistic experience. The landscapes, wildlife, and historical landmarks are all meticulously rendered, making every location feel alive and authentic.

The second-generation graphics engine used in Odyssey allows for incredible depth in lighting, texture, and environmental detail, making the game particularly enjoyable for players who appreciate stunning visuals. Whether you’re exploring the depths of a sunken ruin or battling enemies in the shadow of Mount Olympus, the world is breathtaking and a joy to explore.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Almost 90 hours into the game and all progress is lost. UPlay does not allow syncing cloud save but shows that they do have the save from a previous time. All I get is the "Failed to synchronize" error. I even reached out to customer support and have not heard back from them but based on internet searches, I do not have hope as there are many others who had the same unfortunate fate of losing all their progress. If you do play ANY Ubisoft games, I advise you to not use cloud saves every! Keep a local backup.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Better then origins, scaling is odd and the main quest enemies are easier then most random encounters. The pace is somewhat all over the place too

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
TL;DR Worth the play. 7/10

This game is really cool at many parts and you can really get into the whole Greek mythology that's woven into the game. I was a little disappointed with the lack of fights with monsters and legends from Greek mythology. I mean the cover of the game shows an epic battle with medusa, but the fight is boring, lengthy, and not very challenging whatsoever. The pacing is a little off as well. The pacing is much better going into the later chapters, but early on the game moves really slow! Other than that, the game allows for multiple play styles and lets you be creative as to how you want to accomplish a task, not too much different than the previous game in the title. 

The DLC's were hit and miss. The Atlantis DLC was great for the first 2 thirds, but had a lacklustre ending. The Atlantis DLC has you fight Gods and monsters, something that I hoped for a little more with the base game, but makes the purchase worth it. The opposite with the Legacy of the First Blade, the beginning just felt like a few side missions and eventually ramped up to a better ending. Getting all the Achievements is a slog, and isn't really worth getting them all to 100%. 

Overall if you can get the game with the Atlantis DLC at $50 or less, it's worth grabbing and giving it a try.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
In 2024 its probably the leading AC title. Other AC's felt aimless, go here hack slash there. Odyssey was able to engage a story that was left feeling wanting with the other current titles. Vikings is uninstalled at 50 hours, Odyssey survived. 
Value $43

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Is this a bad game? Not exactly... The only good thing it has going for it is the amazing world. The rest is shallow. I loved the OLD AC games and this one i had finally came back after AC3 or Brotherhood. The combat is the same thing every time and the story just isn't that good along with forgettable characters. The game is good enough to keep you playing. The first dlc is such a meme since its like a repeat of the main game (another cult?) and i could just not handle playing the second dlc and stopped. so many pointless quests

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
If you're looking for a game to buy. Don't buy this one. It is a ridiculous waste of time. You have to restart the entire game everytime you want to even change the settings by a smidgen, and if that setting isn't what you needed to change, have fun changing what you needed to change and restarting again. 

Ubisoft continues to make things so much worse than they need to.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Great game, fun gamplay and a lot of loore presented in a fun way. There are some descrepances with actual history and mythology but it is Ubisoft so what do you expect.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: This game is honestly boring. It is repetitive almost immediately. Even on nightmare difficultly it is not particularly challenging, and it is hollow as an "open world" game because you are doing the same activity (with practically identical stories) everywhere you go. It's like playing tetris but for a different "reason" each time. There's nothing new to it as soon as you start, and if you haven't already I'd recommend something else. I _really_ enjoyed origins, and got this because I wanted to extend that gameplay. Boy was I wrong there.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Assassin's Creed: Odyssey is not just a game; it's an odyssey in the truest sense, a sprawling, breathtaking adventure that transports you to the heart of Ancient Greece with unprecedented authenticity and depth.

From the moment you don the armor of Alexios or Kassandra, you're plunged into an ancient world that’s as beautiful as it is brutal. The sun casts golden rays on the Aegean Sea, casting shimmering reflections that make you feel the Mediterranean's warmth. Each locale, from the dizzying heights of the Spartan mountains to the labyrinthine streets of Athens, is crafted with painstaking detail, capturing the rich tapestry of Greek civilization in stunning, evocative visuals.

What sets Odyssey apart is its RPG elements, which are seamlessly integrated into the core Assassin’s Creed experience. The skill tree is vast and varied, allowing you to tailor your character to your preferred blend of combat, stealth, and exploration. Whether you want to whisper through the shadows as a silent assassin or charge headlong into battle as a fearsome warrior, the game supports your playstyle with a rewarding progression system.

The dialogues and choices offered throughout the game have weight and consequence, propelling you into a narrative that is deeply personal yet woven into the grand tapestry of the Peloponnesian War. The story branches in ways that feel organic and engaging, ensuring that no two journeys are the same. Every decision, from engaging in philosophical debates with Socrates to making pivotal choices about the fate of entire cities, shapes your legend in the game’s world.

The combat is a blend of precision and spectacle. Abilities such as the Spartan kick provide gleefully cinematic moments, while the parrying and dodging mechanics offer a satisfying challenge. The naval combat, a beloved element from previous games, returns with grander scale and strategic depth. Sailing the Aegean, engaging in ship battles, and diving for underwater treasures are all exhilarating experiences that add layers to the exploration.

Yet, it's the small details that truly elevate this game. The meticulously researched historical accuracy, the dynamic weather system, the ambient soundscapes that make every environment feel alive—these elements collectively immerse you in a way few games manage.

Assassin’s Creed: Odyssey is a triumph, a grand tapestry of an era brought to life with passion and precision. It’s an adventure where every island, every myth, every choice adds to the epic saga that is your odyssey. If ever there was a game that proves the power of interactive storytelling, this is it. Highly recommended for both ardent history buffs and avid gamers alike.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Very boring and repetitive. Fun to explore for the first couple hours then its just a chore to get around. A bunch of fetch quests that you have to sail across the world for. i dont think the loot rpg system works for assassin creed games. Assassins creed 1 and 2 were alot better with altair and ezio. This is ubisoft slop. Long and tedious for the sake of being long and tedious. graphics were nice though. combat was just ok. story is ass. i got this on sale for like 10 bucks and i dont plan on finishing it.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Very bad game, slow leveling up, the story is slow paced, the only good thing is the gameplay

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: When this game came out in 2018, I got a free demo to play and then was gifted the full version for free. Through ubisoft, I already 100% completed this game long ago but when Steam offered it with Achievements (my reason for playing any game), I could not pass it up. So, after purchasing it through Steam and 267 hours in? I am a completionist and I have only gotten 50% of the way through. If you love anything to do with Greek lore, Greek history, Greek mythology, hamming it up with Socrates? Exploring Atlantis? You'll love this! I've been playing since Black Flag and while I am obsessed with Egypt, THIS is the Assassins Creed that I most recommend to people. Do it! You wont be sorry.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Halt the idea that it's an assassin's creed game and you're up for a treat

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: best location , specially i love the sea battle and environment, really I am a fan of all AC series

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
I would say for the most part this game does the exact same thing that Origins did, so i you liked origins you'll likely like this.

Big open world lots of stuff to do in it, but I will say the main issue with the game is they made the world size huge just for the sake of making it huge. There really wasn't a good reason to make it this big, because after 30 hours you start to notice the exact same fortress, the same bandit camps, the same generic world design on all these islands.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: You know those stucked-up cultists and corrupt politicians? yea sneaking up their A$$ and one-shot them is the best feeling that can make u pop

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: detailed and huge open world in a great environment. decent main story with way too many side quests, even after 131 hours i was maybe only 60% finished with the game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: for fans who love Greek mythology, this game is made for you, rich in content and visually stunning. 583h and always motivating to play this masterpiece

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: I usually don't play single player games, but AC Odyssey has been really enjoyable.  There is the right amount of entertainment mixed in with the fighting, it is truly a well made and enjoyable game.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Best AC I have played and completed lots of the extra stuff. Love the setting very pretty and now time has moved on not such a systems hog. lots of exploration and stuff to do in the open world with a more compelling setting that most of the other AC series. Also main characters are charismatic and interesting.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
I hadnt played any AC games in a long while, I tried origins but forgot i had bought the game. 
This is the only AC game ive played and enjoyed, it can be tedious but i did like the gameplay and the story was interesting. Seems like AC games are a hit or miss these days but I liked that Odyssey does try something different with the abilities and fighting mythical creatures, it was interesting :)

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Damn. This. Game. Is. So. Amazing! I don't know enough English words to describe it. Many players might not agree with me, but to me, it’s a masterpiece. I love history, I love Ancient Greece, I love the atmosphere, and I love Assassin's Creed Odyssey. It’s such a beautiful game set in my favorite historical period. I've completed this game four times before, though on a hacked version, which I condemn. I should have bought it a long time ago! So, if it’s on sale — DAMN, GET IT!

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Yelp - forget entirely about playing as an Assassin. As an RPG game set in the mythical land of Ancient Greece - its great. open world and exploration are great. voice acting of a few characters could be better. the map does seem a little cluttery at times - not becuz it aint big enough - but becuz of the sheer no. of items and events and quests. Great if you like RPGs not so much if you're a fan of the older more traditional AC experience by Ubisoft.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
This is more of a review for the AC mythology trilogy as a whole, rather than just AC Odyssey.

My most recent experience with an AC game before AC Odyssey was AC Black Flag. If memory serves, AC Black Flag was the first major title video game I ever played, and as an all-time great, it absolutely amazed me as a kid and opened my eyes to the world of gaming. While I tried AC Syndicate upon its release, it didn’t resonate with me the same way AC Black Flag did. At that point, the AC series has declined, with little to no innovation, becoming repetitive and boring.

Then I heard that Ubisoft had revamped the AC series, launching the AC mythology trilogy. Since I’m not particularly interested in Egyptian mythology, I skipped AC Origins and started with AC Odyssey as the first game in the trilogy. It’s quite different from the traditional AC games I remember from AC Black Flag, featuring a more warrior-oriented play style rather than the stealth-based approach, which is a common shift across the trilogy.

I don’t dislike this shift like some people do; in fact, I kinda like it. AC Odyssey also features a dual protagonist setup, which is interesting. (My girlfriend and I both played through the game, with me as Alexios and her as Kassandra.) The ending of the story is choice-driven, a first for me in an ARPG. Although there aren’t as many choice-matter situations and possible endings as you’d find in CRPGs, I still find it a nice touch. Overall, it was fun playing through the main story, though I stopped soon after as all the remaining side quests felt the same and repetitive.

I did try AC Valhalla after AC Odyssey, as I’m an even bigger fan of Norse mythology than Greek mythology. AC Valhalla looks absolutely stunning. However, I couldn’t progress through it at all. If AC Valhalla had been my first game in the trilogy, I probably would’ve enjoyed it. But having played it after AC Odyssey, the gameplay was simply too repetitive. With that being said, your favorite among the AC mythology trilogy will likely be the first one you play. Most people probably wouldn’t have the endurance to play a second one in the trilogy, so choose the first one to play based on the mythology that interests you the most.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: Having never played an Assassin's Creed game before, this was quite fun! I was a Greek mythology kid growing up so this was right up my alley. I am writing this review right after completing all three Odysseys, and so now I have to decide if i am going to continue to discover the whole map and complete questlines.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
This game lends itself to the apex of what I believe is the antithesis of Assassins Creed. Unfortunately so influenced by the other loot-based RPGs of the time, this is truly an enjoyable combat system and a major downgrade. 
In fact, playing this game for just 10 hours I resolved to buy and play through Black Flag on the PS4, which is by far a superior assassins creed experience, story, gameplay, and feature wise.

review:
impossible to run this game. uses its own bloatware launcher to access the game, and guess what? the page to register a new account doesnt work. after giving all my details and click submit, nothing. just refreshes the page and nothing. same on their website. 

frustrating pointless launcher.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: They require you to either grind boring and pointless side quests or BUY exp boosters. In a singleplayer game. Like WTF??

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
Assassin's Creed: Odyssey
----------------------------------------
This game takes you on an epic journey through Ancient Greece, with an immense world to explore.
The map is HUGE, and every corner is filled with beautiful landscapes, cities, and hidden secrets.

Odyssey’s story adds depth to the world, letting you choose your own path.
You can be Kassandra or Alexios, but let’s be real...

The gameplay is solid, with combat, stealth, and exploration all feeling satisfying.
However, the world is so big that it can drag on at times, especially with so many quests.
Still, there’s plenty of variety, from naval battles to fighting mythical creatures.

The RPG elements, like leveling up and customizing your gear, add extra layers of fun.
It’s not perfect, but Odyssey’s scope and freedom make it stand out.

If you love open-world games, you’ll enjoy getting lost in Greece.

Just be ready to spend a lot of time there!

Enjoy your Odyssey!

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review: All the great RPG features introduced in Origins are completely screwed in Odyssey with the auto-leveling. The enemies are sponges, combat feels like you punching enemies with a rubber baton. Silent assassinations are almost never one hit kill even with the critical assassination skill. The story is good enough to keep you entertained. All and all it is playable.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
review:
-Be on your way to do the 2578th dumb fetch quest
-Get randomly atttacked by four chickens in town, no one knows why. This is a serious encounter, as chikens kill you in 3 hits no matter what overpowered gear, level or powers you have. Nice hero vibe...
-get attacked by villagers who want to avenge the chikens
-get attacked by each and every soldier in town magically knowing where you are no matter where you hide because you murdered villagers
-have a horde of mercenaries follow you for the next hour of gameplay to collect the bounty you accrued for defending yourself, preventing you from doing anything else than fighting

0/10 would play again a game punishing you for its own bugs...
